attributes.action: TFL to remove the offensive adverts, that advertise North Cyprus.
attributes.background: TFL have approved an advert advertising holidays to North Cyprus an UNRECOGNISED occupied territory of the Republic of Cyprus, which came into so called existence due to the Turkish invasion in 1974, displacing hundreds of thousands of Cypriots, who still to this day can not return to their homes.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. TfL is accountable to the London Assembly. 

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: 

https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions
